As with anything, choosing to do something yields very different results than being forced into it; I thought I would share a little of my experience, what I‚Äôve found to work and not work, and how the flexibility of working for Seeq has enabled me to, at times, combine parenting and working.

Title: Don‚Äôt track bugs, fix them
Description: You do not need a bug tracking system. In fact, a bug tracking system is a symptom of a deeper problem‚Äîinsufficient focus on quality. In general, I fix bugs the moment they appear‚Äînot in a drop-everything sense, but as soon as I can get to it‚Äîusually within a few hours, but sometimes in a day or two when I‚Äôm done with the current story. Of course, if I‚Äôm working in the code when I notice a bug, I just fix it right then. The software I write has no known bugs in it as a consequence (and yes, I never

Title: Zig Build System Internals

Title: AT2 demonstrator
Description:
Asynchronous Trustworthy Transfer (AT2) is a research project developed at
                    Prof. Rachid Guerraoui's Distributed Computing Lab, at EPFL. It is a new way to transfer assets (such as coins) throughout a network of potentially
                    rogue participants. It is quite close to Bitcoin in its capabilities, while being orders of magnitudes faster and consuming much less energy.

Title: How to be miserable after a breakup
Description:
1. Text her, often
You don't want her to get away. There's probably still hope. Whether you broke up with her or she with you, you need to try everything in your power to win her back. It doesn't matter if she isn't responding -- be persistent.

If she asks you to stop texting her, start calling and leave voicemails. She'll change her mind once she understands how committed you are.

2. Check her social media
You need to be on top of this one. As soon as she posts a story on Instagram, watch it. Let her know that you're there and you care. Let her know you're paying attention.

If she posts a picture, like it. If you're feeling extra brave, leave a comment ‚Äî just an emoji or two is enough. Anything to remind her that you're still out there, thinking of her.

3. Drink and do drugs
Drinking is your friend. Alcohol is cheap and does wonders when trying to push the pain away. Maybe start with a fifth of vodka every night?

If you haven't already, start doing drugs. But I'm not talking about weed ‚Äî weed is for pussies. Buy cocaine, MDMA, and ketamine. Also, make sure you do all your drugs alone. Doing drugs with friends can sometimes be fun, but you don't want that. You want to maximize misery.

If you remember what you did yesterday, you're doing it wrong. Keep drinking.

4. Spend money
If you want to maximize misery, you will need to maximize financial problems. You're a grown-up with multiple credit cards, which is basically unlimited money. Why sit on them?

5. Sleep around
This one should be obvious. You're single, young, and don't have to spend money on a girl anymore. Download all the dating apps and free up your weekends to go to bars and talk to girls.

The goal here is to push down your fear of being alone through meaningless sex. Also, don't let them spend the night so that you can wake up all alone, questioning when you'll ever find real love again. Now, back to swiping.

6. Drown yourself in work
But not in a healthy way. You want to be working at least 14 hours a day. This may sound difficult, but they have drugs for that now. Adderall, Ritalin, Vyvanse, Modafinil, etc. Get a prescription and start consuming. The good thing is that these drugs will suppress your hunger (and passion for anything else), so you can start skipping meals and have more time for work.

7. Make her jealous
Post pictures of you with other girls on Instagram. Book a vacation and share photos liberally. Start hitting on her friends -- this is a surefire way of getting her attention even if she isn't looking at your social media.

Do whatever you can to get her attention and make her jealous. This endless pursuit to win her back will bring you misery, guaranteed.

Now, if you don't want to be miserable after a breakup, do the exact opposite of everything above. Delete your social media, stop drinking, stop doing drugs, go to the gym, start meditating, read, learn new things, eat healthily.

You can do this, king.

Title: Gnome Clipboard History

Title: Eventually consistency and cache
Description:
What is it? Eventually consistency is a fancy name of doing something and only expecting the changed state after a while. And there is a guarantee that you will eventually get the expected state. Hence, consistency.
But that won‚Äôt work well with caching. And I had to deal with that recently when working with WhatsApp API.
When querying for a list of message templates from WhatsApp, we‚Äôll cache the response for use later.

Title: Building meaningful relationships with remote colleagues
Description:
I have a diary. I‚Äôve been writing on it somewhat regularly since 2014. I find it extremely useful and I think everyone should at least give it a try. I do it for two reasons:
When writing, a diary is a great tool for organizing thoughts and making decisions. The process of writing forces you to articulate thoughts with much greater clarity than you could by just sitting down and thinking.
